member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderLocationType
member.summary: Indicates additional data about the specified location.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderLocationType.Rooftop
member.summary: Indicates that the returned result reflects a precise geocode.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderLocationType.RangeInterpolated
member.summary: indicates that the returned result reflects an approximation (usually on a road) interpolated between two precise points (such as intersections). Interpolated results are generally returned when rooftop geocodes are unavailable for a street address.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderLocationType.GeometricCenter
member.summary: Indicates that the returned result is the geometric center of a result such as a polyline (for example, a street) or polygon (region).

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderLocationType.Approximate
member.summary: Indicates that the returned result is approximate.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult
member.summary: represents a single geocoding result.
member.remarks: A geocode request may return multiple result objects.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.IsError
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is error.
member.value: true if this instance is error; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.ResultCode
member.summary: Gets the result code.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.Types
member.summary: Gets an array indicating the address type of the returned result.
member.value: The array indicating the address type of the returned result.
member.remarks: This array contains a set of zero or more tags identifying the type of feature returned in the result.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.FormattedAddress
member.summary: Gets the human-readable address of this location.
member.value: The human-readable address of this location.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.AddressComponents
member.summary: Gets an array of separate components applicable to this address.
member.value: The array of separate components applicable to this addresss.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.PartialMatch
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that the geocoder did not return an exact match for the original request, though it was able to match part of the requested address.
member.value: true if the geocoder did not return an exact match; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.PlaceId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of a place, which can be used with other Google APIs.
member.value: The unique identifier of a place.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.GeocoderResult.PostcodeLocalities
member.summary: Gets an rray denoting all the localities contained in a postal code.
member.value: The rray denoting all the localities contained in a postal code.
member.remarks: Is only present when the result is a postal code that contains multiple localities. This array can contain up to 10 localities

member.summary: Gets the geocode geeometry information.

member.summary: Indicates the separate components applicable to an addresss

member.summary: Gets the full text description or name of the address component as returned by the Geocoder.

member.summary: Gets an array denoting all the localities contained in a postal code.
member.value: The array denoting all the localities contained in a postal codes.
member.remarks: Is only present when the result is a postal code that contains multiple localities. This array can contain up to 10 localities.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Ext.GoogleMaps.LatLng
member.summary: A LatLng is a point in geographical coordinates: latitude and longitude.
member.remarks:
Latitude ranges between -90 and 90 degrees, inclusive. Values above or below this range will be clamped to the range [-90, 90]. This means that if the value specified is less than -90, it will be set to -90. And if the value is greater than 90, it will be set to 90.
Longitude ranges between -180 and 180 degrees, inclusive.Values above or below this range will be wrapped so that they fall within the range. For example, a value of -190 will be converted to 170. A value of 190 will be converted to -170. This reflects the fact that longitudes wrap around the globe.
Although the default map projection associates longitude with the x-coordinate of the map, and latitude with the y-coordinate, the latitude coordinate is always written first, followed by the longitude. Notice that you cannot modify the coordinates of a LatLng. If you want to compute another point, you have to create a new one.
